reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: WMD Cyber Crimes Investigations. WMD Border Security and Interdiction. WMD Investigative Analysis. International Dual-Use Investigations. International Joint Bioterrorism Response

description.narrative: Strengthen the global community's ability to safely destroy, store, apply safeguards to, and transport weapons of mass destruction (WMD) and secure related facilities and materials; control borders and territory to prevent illicit movement of WMD and related materials and technology and to prosecute and punish violators; prevent the proliferation of WMD and related materials, technology, and expertise to states or non-state actors of concern or to potential terrorists; comply fully with international obligations concerning arms control, nonproliferation, and WMD terrorism; deter and prevent WMD terrorism; and respond to a WMD terrorism event.

This award strives to strengthen the global community's ability to safely destroy, store, apply safeguards to, and transport weapons of mass destruction (WMD) and secure related facilities and materials. More specifically, this includes DTRA ICP delivered training to 24 nontechnical Indian law enforcement investigators on the skills needed to exploit digitial technology to combat criminal activities, the proliferation of WMD, and the misuse of dual-use materials and technologies.. DTRA ICP conducted training for 23 Indian law enforcement and border security officials on developing a viable border interdiction strategy through interagency cooperation and the importance of border security in the interdiction of WMD and other contraband.. DTRA ICP delivered training to 20 Indian law enforcement personel of the National Investigation Agency to provide a foundation of WMD investigative analysis strategies and techniques to conduct a WMD-focused investigation.. DTRA ICP conducted training with 35 Indian customs officials from the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence to build capacity for understanding of multilateral export control regimes, investigative techniques, and transnational investigations.. DTRA ICP conducted training for 21 mid-level Indian public health and law enforcement authorities responsible for deterring, detecting, identifying, and responding to a bioterrorism incident with a broad overview of bioterrorism and its relationship to WMD proliferation..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: India is the anchor of South Asia, one of the United States' most important bilateral partners, and a rising global power with a multi-billion dollar economy. In the last several years the relationship has risen to a new level of cooperation, where the United States and India are working positively across a multitude of sectors to advance shared national interests. One common area of interest is the pursuit of sustainable development, and the United States and India are now working jointly to achieve their shared development goals for India, the Asia Pacific Region, and global progress. New commitments include initiatives to mitigate the impact of climate change, achieve global health and food security objectives, and ensure continued regional integration and stability. U.S. assistance in India is used to advance this shared agenda by engaging a range of stakeholders to end extreme poverty - which affects 21.3 percent of India's population, according to the World Bank - and increase citizens' access to quality health care, education, water and sanitation, and energy. Through this assistance, the United States also helps to support and protect vulnerable women, girls, and minority groups. With assistance, the United States is piloting a new model of development, whereby partnerships and platforms created jointly with the Government of India (GOI), private sector stakeholders, and civil society organizations are used to scale proven solutions locally and globally.

title.narrative: U.S. General Services Administration Federal Government
